snippet: Some Alzheimer’s patients who used the therapy, already approved for immune disorders, showed no worsening of symptoms for three years.
abstract: Results of a small study show that a drug already on the market to treat immune disorders may help stabilize patients with Alzheimer's disease for up to three years; four patients received doses of Gammagard from Baxter International and had no decline in several measures of cognition and daily function over the course of the study; experts say that results are not conclusive and that the drug may not be responsible for the stabilization; further trials are planned.
lead_paragraph: Some Alzheimer’s patients who used the therapy, already approved for immune disorders, showed no worsening of symptoms for three years.

headline.seo: Trial Hints Baxter’s Gammagard Can Slow Alzheimer’s
headline.main: Small Trial Hints Drug Can Slow Alzheimer’s
headline.print_headline: Small Trial Hints Drug Can Slow Alzheimer’s
